title: What is phantom traffic and why is it ruining your life? - Benjamin Seibold

multiple-choice.question: What is a phantom traffic jam?

options.label: A
options.text: A traffic jam caused by a major accident or road closure

options.label: B
options.text: An emergent phenomenon that occurs when traffic comes to a near standstill for no apparent reason

options.label: C
options.text: A traffic jam caused by a narrow road or construction

options.label: D
options.text: A traffic jam caused by a change in speed limit

multiple-choice.question: What is the critical density of cars on the road that leads to dynamic instability?
What is the primary cause of phantom traffic jams?

options.label: C
options.text: A wave of brake lights that propagates backward through the cars on the road

options.label: D
options.text: A major accident or road closure

multiple-choice.question: How do drivers contribute to the formation of phantom traffic jams?

options.label: A
options.text: By maintaining a uniform speed and following a safe distance

options.label: B
options.text: By braking harder than necessary and accelerating too rapidly out of a slowdown

options.label: C
options.text: By driving too fast and not following traffic laws

options.label: D
options.text: By not using their turn signals

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential solution to phantom traffic jams?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Increasing the number of traffic police

options.label: C
options.text: Equipping self-driving cars with data on traffic conditions ahead

options.label: B
options.text: One autonomous vehicle for every 10 human drivers

options.label: C
options.text: One autonomous vehicle for every 20 human drivers

options.label: D
options.text: One autonomous vehicle for every 50 human drivers

multiple-choice.question: What are the benefits of reducing phantom traffic jams?

options.label: B
options.text: Increased road safety and reduced fatalities

options.label: C
options.text: Improved air quality and reduced traffic jams

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of drivers in contributing to phantom traffic jams?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Drivers are responsible for phantom traffic jams due to their behavior

options.label: C
options.text: Drivers are not aware of the causes of phantom traffic jams

options.label: D
options.text: Drivers are not affected by phantom traffic jams

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between the density of cars on the road and the formation of phantom traffic jams?

options.label: A
options.text: The density of cars on the road has no effect on the formation of phantom traffic jams

options.label: B
options.text: The density of cars on the road leads to the formation of phantom traffic jams

options.label: C
options.text: The density of cars on the road is a critical factor in the formation of phantom traffic jams

options.label: D
options.text: The density of cars on the road has a minor effect on the formation of phantom traffic jams

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential impact of self-driving cars on reducing phantom traffic jams?

options.label: B

options.label: C

title: Why is cotton in everything? - Michael R. Stiff

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary cell wall of the cotton fiber responsible for?

options.label: B
options.text: Pushing cell growth in one direction

multiple-choice.question: What makes up 34% of the cell wall at the stage of strengthening the cell wall?
What determines the strength of the final fiber?

options.label: B
options.text: The density of the secondary cell wall

multiple-choice.question: What influences the softness of the fiber?

options.label: A
options.text: The density of the secondary cell wall

multiple-choice.question: After about 50 days, what happens to the living matter within the cell?

options.label: A
options.text: It dies off, leaving behind only the cellulose

options.label: A
options.text: A burst of several thousand fiber cells in a fluffy mass

options.label: B
options.text: A decrease in the length of the fiber

options.label: C
options.text: An increase in the density of the secondary cell wall

options.label: D
options.text: A decrease in the strength of the final fiber

options.label: A
options.text: Fabric, coffee filters, diapers, and fishing nets

options.label: A
options.text: The length of the fiber increases

options.label: B
options.text: The density of the secondary cell wall increases

options.label: B
options.text: To make the cotton fiber stronger

options.label: C
options.text: To make the cotton fiber softer

options.label: D
options.text: To make the cotton fiber more resilient

title: Grit: the power of passion and perseverance - Angela Lee Duckworth

multiple-choice.question: What was Angela Duckworth's initial career before becoming a psychologist?

options.label: B
options.text: Teacher in the New York City public schools

multiple-choice.question: What was the main finding of Angela Duckworth's research on grit?

options.label: A
options.text: Grit is a significant predictor of success in various challenging settings.

options.label: B
options.text: Grit is unrelated to IQ and other measures of talent.

options.label: C
options.text: Grit is a fixed trait that cannot be developed.

options.label: D
options.text: Grit is a necessary condition for achieving success.

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: D
